hedline.hl1: Burger King Narrows Field for U.S. Account

abstract.p: Burger King Corp narrows review of its US general market advertising account to 6 contenders from 15; billings estimated at $400 million (S)

block.p: The Burger King Corporation in Miami, part of Diageo P.L.C., has narrowed a review for its United States general market advertising account to 6 contenders from 15. Billings were estimated at $400 million.

Three are units of the Interpublic Group of Companies: Lowe Lintas & Partners in New York, part of the Lowe Group, the incumbent since 1994; Campbell Mithun in Minneapolis; and the New York office of McCann-Erickson Worldwide, part of the McCann-Erickson World Group. Two others are units of the Publicis Groupe: Publicis & Hal Riney in San Francisco and Saatchi & Saatchi in New York.

The Burger King Corporation in Miami, part of Diageo P.L.C., has narrowed a review for its United States general market advertising account to 6 contenders from 15. Billings were estimated at $400 million.

Three are units of the Interpublic Group of Companies: Lowe Lintas & Partners in New York, part of the Lowe Group, the incumbent since 1994; Campbell Mithun in Minneapolis; and the New York office of McCann-Erickson Worldwide, part of the McCann-Erickson World Group. Two others are units of the Publicis Groupe: Publicis & Hal Riney in San Francisco and Saatchi & Saatchi in New York.

Burger King declined to identify the sixth participant. Advertising Age and Adweek reported that it was Grey Worldwide in New York, part of the Grey Global Group. Grey declined to comment. A decision is expected in the first quarter.
